channel.title: M Garden. on
channel.description: Recent content in M Garden. on

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.
Azure Active Directory (AAD) #Azure #Active-Directory #rbac Azure AD is not simply a cloud version of [[Active Directory]] in Azure as the name might suggest.
ACR (Azure Container Registry) #Azure #cloud #containers #registry #container-registry #docker It is a simple container registry service provided by Azure. It is similar to [[ECR]] Provided by AWS.
Azure App Service #azure #cloud #compute It is a cloud computing based platform for hosting websites in [[Azure]], created and operated by Microsoft.

Azure Virtual Desktop #cloud #Azure #virtual-machines #compute Azure Virtual Desktop, (formerly known as Windows Virtual Desktop) is a Microsoft Azure-based system for [[virtualizing]] its Windows operating systems, aimed at enterprise customers rather than at individual users.
Azure Load Balancer #Azure #cloud Is used for evenly distributing incoming network traffic across a group of backend resources or servers using OSI Layer 4 (Transport Layer).
NSG (Network Security Groups) #Azure #cloud #security #security-groups An [[Azure]] networking firewall like service similar to [[AWS NSG]].

WAF #Azure #cloud #security #waf A cloud native [[WAF 1]] Solution by [[Azure]] which protects web-apps from common cyber attacks. Azure WAF consists of [[Azure WAF#Managed Rules]] and [[Azure WAF#Custom Rules]] .
Azure Blob Storage #Azure #cloud #storage It is a object storage solution provided by [[Azure]] for cloud-native workloads, data archives, data lakes, etc.
Resource Groups (Azure) #Azure #cloud #organization A required grouping tag for all of the [[Azure]] services. It helps in organizing the resources.
Azure SQL Database #cloud #Azure #databases Azure SQL Database is a PaaS deployment option of Azure SQL that abstracts both the OS and the SQL Server instance provided by [[Azure]].

Subscriptions #Azure #cloud An [[Azure]] subscription isÂ a logical container used to provision resources in Azure. It holds the details of all your resources like virtual machines (VMs), databases, and more.
VM (Virtual Macines) #Azure #cloud #compute It is a simple compute service provided by [[Azure]] to host [[VM]]s in a [[VNET]].

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)
